pages.text: The $(9)Gem Cutting Table$() is used to upgrade $(l:apotheosis:adventure/affix_loot/gems)Gems$(). Gems can be upgraded by increasing their rarity or increasing the number of facets.

pages.title: Rarity
pages.text: Like an Affix Item, each gem has a $(l:apotheosis:adventure/affix_loot/rarities)rarity$(). The rarity, alongside the number of facets, determines the strength of the gem.$(p)The rarity of a gem can be upgraded by combining two $(9)Flawless$() gems of the same rarity.

pages.title: Facets
pages.text: Every gem has $(9)Facets$(), a measure of the relative strength for a gem. A gem can be cut, increasing the number of facets, with rarity materials.$(p)A gem with the minimum number of facets is referred to as $(7)Cracked$(), while a gem with the maximum amount is known as $(9)Flawless$().
The maximum number of facets a gem may have varies by gem and by rarity, but the minimum number of facets that any gem may have is four.
